title: Task-agnostic Prompt Compression with Context-aware Sentence Embedding and Reward-guided Task Descriptor
author: Barys Liskavets (Alterra AI), Shuvendu Roy (Queen's University), Maxim Ushakov (Alterra AI), Mark Klibanov (Workday Inc.), Ali Etemad (Queen's University), Shane Luke (Workday Inc.)
relevance_why: The method provides a way to compress prompts effectively without requiring explicit tasks or questions, which can enhance the usability and efficiency of generating audio-related content and models, potentially benefiting Dr. Liu's research in audio generation.
background: This work focuses on compressing input prompts for Large Language Models (LLMs) across various tasks without relying on specific queries, making it useful for time and cost-efficient inference.
contribution: This paper introduces a task-agnostic prompt compression framework to solve the inefficiency in lengthy prompts, achieving effective compression with superior performance over existing methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods rely on explicit questions or handcrafted templates, limiting their applicability across diverse tasks.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a context-aware task descriptor and reinforcement learning for fine-tuning without requiring specific questions.

key_innovation: Utilizes a combination of a task descriptor to generate relevant task descriptions and a context-aware sentence encoder to assess sentence relevance.
real_world_impact: This framework could significantly reduce computational costs and time associated with LLM inferences, leading to faster and more efficient audio processing applications.
limitations: The method's performance may still depend on the quality of the training datasets used for task descriptors.

new_terms.task descriptor: **Task descriptor** is a model that generates a relevant description for a given input prompt, helping gauge sentence relevance based on context.
new_terms.context-aware sentence encoder: **Context-aware sentence encoder** refers to an encoder that considers surrounding context to evaluate and rank the relevance of sentences in a prompt.

open_sourcing: Datasets and codebase will be released upon publication.
